buttons.create-lss-entry: Et privatam rem in LSS face

html.import-code-placeholder: Pone codicem tuum spectaculi, tunc botonem EXPORTA pulsa.

text.gamestyle-notice: Formam elige! In ludo hoc, uterque forma petit ut originem similet. Ergo, formae ludorum non sunt consociabiles, sic cogita de forma quam tu utere vis.
text.theme-notice:
Nunc, elige thema et nomen spectaculi tui!
Postea hos mutare potes. Thema in fabrica mutari potest.
text.delete-warning:
Hoc spectaculum delere vis?
Si contingat ut hoc ludere vel mutare voles postea, serva codicem spectaculi in computatro tuo primum.
text.code-notice: Hunc codicem spectaculi cum aliis partire potes! Et suademus ut codices serves pro asservatione.
text.compact-notice: Codices arti habet solas informationes quae egentur ut spectaculum tuum faciat, sine informationibus quae servatus est pro factoribus spectaculum.
text.production-notice: Codex productio servat informationes quae est adjutabilis dum spectaculum facis, e.g. res in talea dilectorum.
text.import-code-notice: Pone codicem spectaculi, et spectaculum in ludo servabitur. Adhuc, suademus ut subsidiarios spectaculi tui saepe facias servando codicem in computatro tuo et/aut in LSS.
text.first-paste-code: Primum codicem spectaculi tuum pone debes.
text.unrecognized-code: Me paenitet, hic codex spectaculi legi non potest.
text.outdated-version: Hic codex spectaculi pro versione noviore Super Mario Construct factus est.

labels.no-desc: Nulla expositio pro hoc spectaculo statutus est.

html.level-code-placeholder: Pone codicem spectaculi et LUDE pulsa!

tileset-menu.footer:
Iconem grupi tegularum pulsa ut paginam eius aperiias.[scale=0.5]

[/scale]Iconem grupi tegularum devexa ad talea dilectorum ut id intres ab ubique in fabrica.

labels.offset-y:
Compensare Y[scale=0.5]
Abaculi ante principium coloris gradientis[/scale]
labels.autosave-interval: Servare automaticum omnibus quinque minutis facit
labels.restore-point-info:
[scale=0.5][color=#CCCCCC]Puncta restutionis sunt subsidiarii spectaculi tui, qui automaticus creatur cum spectaculum servatur post tempore statuto.
Ad priori versione spectaculi tui a puncto restutionis eare potes.[/background][/scale]

buttons.prompt-backup-notice:
[scale=0.75]Note omnibus ... ut subsidiarium importes[/scale]
[scale=0.5][color=#CCCCCC](Suadetur in SMC interretis)[/color][/scale]

tooltips.destination-layer-output-info: Stratum in quo ludio positus erit (cum a tubo exit, in strato destniationis ponitur, tunc in hoc strato electo).
tooltips.layer-tags: Pittacium(ia) arbitrarium quod utitur ut adloquat stratum hoc. Strata multa pittacia habere possunt (quae separantur a diesmatibus) et ea pittacia partire possunt.
tooltips.layer-darkness:
Operimentum tenebrarum facit, et strata sub hoc strato afflectat.
Tenebrae globales inveniri possunt in [color=#F7F76D]effectus scaenae[/color].
tooltips.water-mode: Cum ad SEMPER statuuntur, res semper agent quasi in aqua sunt, sine egestate pro tegulis aquae.
tooltips.screenwrap: Cum habilitatur, ludio (et res aliae) ad lateras alias spectaculi ibit cum a terminis spectaculi exit.
tooltips.bg-loop-notice: Plurimi muri tantummodo iterat horizontaliter, sed sunt muri qui iterare verticaliter possunt (e.g. interior arcis). Optiones has adaptare potes hic.
tooltips.text-formatting:
[scale=0.8]Scriptiones in BBCodes involvere potes ut species earum mutes.

[color=#58A8F0][[][/]color=#cc0000][/color][color=#cc0000]Color scriptionis[/color][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/color][/color]
[color=#58A8F0][[][/]background=#ff00ff][/color][background=#ff00ff]color muri[/background][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/background][/color]

[color=#58A8F0][[][/]scale=0.5][/color][scale=0.5]Magnitudem scriptionis muta[/scale][color=#58A8F0][[][/]/scale][/color]
[/offsety][/scale]
tooltips.favorites-bar:
Talea dilectorum te indulget ut res consuetas confisces et sumas. Semper in talea instrumentorum est, sed eam removere potes cum spectaculi fabricas.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Boto pro habilitando/debilitando: F[/color][/scale]
tooltips.mini-toolbar:
Haec minor talea instrumentorum est semper visibilis cum habilitatur, et mutandum celere stratorum indulget.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Boto pro habilitando/debilitando: M[/color][/scale]
tooltips.inactive-layer-opacity: Cum stratum tegularum mutas, tegulae aliae translucidae erunt. Ponere 100 hoc debilitabit, ponere 0 strata invisibiles faciet.
tooltips.trail-tool-frame-count:
Cum spectaculum pertemptas, Mario vestigium visibilem relinquere potest. Hoc est quantitas imaginum quam Mario relinquit.
Hoc adjunctum vestigii in talea instrumentorum est, in solo sinistero. (in pertemptando).
tooltips.backup-interval-notice: Monitus es: Hoc non est in tempore reali, sed in tempore insumptus est in fabrica.

html.1_water-modes: Debilis|Semper (tegulas aquae non eget)|Tecta aqua (antiqua)|Tecta aqua (moderna)
html.bg-loop-methods: Debilis|Itera horizontaliter|Itera verticaliter|Itera omnes|Noli iterare|Tantummodo horizontaliter|Tantummodo verticaliter
html.bg-scroll-speed-h: ←← CelerISSIME!|← Celeriter|← Mediana|← Segniter|← Segnissime|Debilis|→ Segnissime|→ Segniter|→ Mediana|→ Celeriter|→→ CelerISSIME!
html.bg-scroll-speed-v: ↑↑ CelerISSIME!|↑ Celeriter|↑ Mediana|↑ Segniter|↑ Segnissime|Debilis|↓ Segnissime|↓ Segniter|↓ Mediana|↓ Celeriter|↓↓ CelerISSIME!
html.level-desc-placeholder: Scribe conjectionem brevem (arbitrariam) spectaculi tui, eius narrationis, aut alicuius de quo ludio scire debet et qui fortasse adjutabilis erit.
html.editor-music: Nihil (silens)|Musica spectaculi|Musica spectaculi (obfuscata)|★ Cotidie musica specialis muta|♪ Brothers At Home (Musica specialis #1)|♪ Morning Drive (Musica specialis #2)|♪ Lunch Break (Musica specialis #3)|♪ The Road is Full Of Dangers (SMRPG)|♪ Creative Exercise (Mario Paint)

text.obj-pipe: [scale=0.75]Tubi in hac pagina quasi [/scale]res[scale=0.75] agunt (non [/scale]tegulae[scale=0.75]), et in tegulas rerum eunt. Hi tubi porrigere possunt et mutari possunt ut porrigant et adtenuent per tempore.[/scale]
text.pipe-sprite-spawner: [scale=0.75]Hic generator invisibilis rerum est. Si generator tubi creare vis, eum in tubum devexa! Primum eum statue.[/scale]
text.electric-tiles: Eae sunt tegulae electricae quae plurimas creaturas animantes volnerare possunt. Res metallici, velut Mario Metallicus, electricitatem temporaliter conducere possunt!
text.scenery-doors: Monitus es: hae ianuae decorandae. Si ianuas operatorias petis, ad tabulam ITINERA ire pulsando iconem TUBI in solo.
text.advanced-platform:
Pegma Provectum
[scale=0.75]Haec pegmata multimodis mutari possunt! Tegulae a eis conversationem eorum afflectare possunt.[/scale]
text.persistent-area-tile: Res in una area existitae servat
text.area-object-loader: Res antecedenter creat in una area
text.tag-tile: Actiones adjunctorum et rerum dinotatae gerit
text.invis-sprite-spawner: Generator invisibilis rerum, qui in tubos devexari potest
text.current-gen: Creat amnem qui res deflat aut desugit
text.tag-block: Cubus qui pittacia habilitat aut debilitat
text.cheep-cheeps:
Cora-Cora
[scale=0.75]Cora-Corae multos agitatus AR (artificiosae rationis) habent. Pone cursorem tuum super illis ut gnoscas![/scale]
text.stretch-tiles: [scale=0.75]Replica deorsum ut alias tegulas Porriga invenias![/scale]
text.artillery-tiles:
Aliae tegulae cognatae
[scale=0.75]Illae sunt tegulae arbitrariae quae partes rerum super imitant.[/scale]
text.king-bill:
Rex Regulus
[scale=0.75]Hoc magnum telum cubos doros in semita eius facile delere potest, et indissolubile est![/scale]
text.view-map-code: Hic est codex scaenae: Is informationes omnes de scaena tua habet. Tu codicem hunc utere potes ut exemplarem identicum spectaculo alio addas, vel ut duplicatum pro hoc spectaculo crees.
text.import-map-code: Pone codicem scaenae. Codices spectaculorum acquiri potest pulsando iconem PARTI in charta scaenae.

sprite-tooltips.green-koopa-flying-static: Caeli Kupa viridis statarius[s]Volitans et stataria
sprite-tooltips.red-koopa-flying-static: Caeli Kupa rubrua statarius[s]Volitans et stataria
sprite-tooltips.blue-koopa-flying: Caeli Kupa caeruleua volans[s]Ludionem subsequitur semper
sprite-tooltips.yellow-koopa-flying: Caeli Kupa flava volans[s]Ludionem destinat, tunc provolat
sprite-tooltips.blue-beach-koopa-sliding: Actae Kupa caerulea labens[s]Si in clivi ponitur, labit deorsus

tile-tooltips.invisible-solid-tile: Tegula solda invisibilis[s]Invisibilis in ludo est
tile-tooltips.solid-player-tile: Tegula solda ludionis[s]Visibilis pro ludione solo est
tile-tooltips.solid-sprite-tile: Tegula solda rerum[s]Visibilis pro rebus solis est
tile-tooltips.semisolid-player-tile: Tegula semisolda ludionis[s]Visibilis pro ludione solo est
tile-tooltips.semisolid-sprite-tile: Tegula semisolda rerum[s]Visibilis pro rebus solis est
tile-tooltips.boss-gate: Foris ducis[s]Visibilis dum dux pugnatur est
tile-tooltips.donut-block: Anulus ordinarius[s]Soldus est, revertere et se corrigere potest
tile-tooltips.donut-block-red: Anulus inconstabilitus[s]Soldus est, revertere potest, cadet post quatiendo
tile-tooltips.donut-block-wood: Anulus lignoleus[s]Soldus est, revertere non potest, se corrigere potest
tile-tooltips.donut-block-metal: Anulus auricalcinus[s]Soldus est, revertere non potest, cadet post quatiendo
tile-tooltips.donut-block-semi: Anulus ordinarius[s]Semisodlus est, revertere et se corrigere potest
tile-tooltips.donut-block-red-semi: Anulus inconstabilitus[s]Semisoldus est, revertere potest, cadet post quatiendo
tile-tooltips.donut-block-wood-semi: Anulus lignoleus[s]Semisoldus est, revertere non potest, se corrigere potest
tile-tooltips.donut-block-metal-semi: Anulus auricalcinus[s]Semisoldus est, revertere non potest, cadet post quatiendo
tile-tooltips.chomp-post: Stipes Commorsicatenae[s]Pone Commorsicatenam in summo ut attachias

tooltips.movement-speed:
Travel speed in pixels / sec.
[sub]One tile equals 16 pixels.[/sub]
tooltips.jump-strength: The initial vertical speed, in pixels / sec, at the start of the jump.
tooltips.blend-modes:
ADDITIVE
[sub]Adds {0}'s colors on top of other overlapping pixels[/sub]

APPEAR ABOVE OBJECTS
[sub]{0} will appear only on objects that are behind him (e.g. on a lower layer.)[/sub]

CAMOUFLAGE
[sub]Same, but is completely invisible and 'cuts through' tiles and sprites![/sub]
tooltips.expanding-obj-cycle-info: Expand and shrink over time, with customization options over the length & durations.
tooltips.expanding-obj-size-change-tiles: The amount of tiles to expand/shrink.
tooltips.expanding-obj-size-change-duration: The time (in seconds) it takes for the expansion/shrinking to complete.
tooltips.expanding-obj-size-change-delay: When it has grown or shrunk, wait this time out before growing/shrinking again
tooltips.period: Time (in seconds) for a complete sine-wave cycle.
tooltips.opacity: Lower opacities can make the sprite less obvious to spot.

text.tagging-notice: When ticked off, the spawner can be made active by calling any of its tags (e.g. through a Tag Tile).
text.sinewave-tool: The sinewave angle & amplitude can be set up by dragging the \[---] tool.

tooltips.start-layer: The layer where the player will start on.
tooltips.start-powerup: The power-up the player will start with.

tooltips.warp-name-tips: Give this {0} a name of your choice. This will allow you to easily identify different {1}.
tooltips.destination-own-layer:
The layer the destination is on, like how tiles and objects are on a layer.
With pipes, the player will be on this layer during the animation.
tooltips.destination-output-layer: This is the layer where the player will be put on once the warp animation has finished and they regain controls.
tooltips.entryway-layer: The layer the entryway is on, like how tiles and objects are on a layer. The player will be on this layer during the entry animation.

headers.boss-start-common:
When the fight begins...
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]This music will play as soon as {0} is on-screen[/color][/scale]
headers.boss-start-kb:
When the fight begins...
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]This music will play after King Boo's appearance animation[/color][/scale]
headers.boss-defeat-common:
When the fight is over
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Music to play once {0} is defeated[/color][/scale]

tooltips.music-to-pick: Pick the music that you want to play. This can also be set to not update the music at all.
tooltips.cm-url-info:
With the Custom music option selected, enter a URL in this field to the location of the music file source.

[sub]Note: it must lead directly to the music file, not the page it may be contained in.[/sub]

sines.cycle-duration-info:
Time (in seconds) it takes for a full {0} sine cycle (includes time travelling back).
[sub](This cannot be smaller than half of the magnitude)[/sub]
sines.period-offset-example: Skip ahead to a specific point in the sine cycle, e.g. entering half of the period here will make {0} start on the opposing end of the sine.

text.text-area-options: Center of the screen|Customised area (range editor)

labels.tags-entered-below: Tags entered below will trigger or pause when hit.

buttons.object-breaks-nearby-player: Object breaks out at nearby players

tooltips.amount-in-block: Amount of objects in the block.
tooltips.amount-in-block-optional: If the block has an object assigned, it will store a maximum of this value inside.
tooltips.timer-info:
Start a timer when hit for the first time. Once it reaches 0, the block will only have 1 object left.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Leave 0 to disable the timer.[/color][/scale]
tooltips.progressive-info: If Mario is small Mario, always give a mushroom, regardless of what item inside.
tooltips.star-chainer-info: When the block is hit when the player has star power, always give a star regardless of what's inside the block.
tooltips.invisible-info: The block cannot be seen initially, but will appear when hit.
tooltips.coins-before-item-info: Release this amount of coins from the block before it dispenses the set item.
tooltips.object-breaks-nearby-player-info: When the player comes near the block, the object inside will break out. When [color=#4CFF00]checked[/color], the timer property is used for the duration of the break animation.
tooltips.tag-block-toggle:
When hitting this block, tags will turn ON or OFF.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]For example, you can toggle underwater currents with the tag '[color=#58A8F0]switchCurrent[/color]' by also entering '[color=#58A8F0]switchCurrent[/color]' in this field.[/color][/scale]

obj-pipes.resize-options-info: Having this set to always will keep the pipe moving, even if the player isn't nearby. With custom ranges, the pipe will start a cycle only once the player gets in range.

baddie-box.cosmetic-notice: Aside from the larger hitbox, all types are purely cosmetic.
baddie-box.object-cap: Maximum amount of objects, spawned by the box, that can be alive at a time. If enemies spawned by this specific Baddie Box are defeated, it will spawn more.
baddie-box.delays: Spawn delay is the time in seconds between each spawn cycle, start delay is the amount of seconds for the Baddie Box to start the spawn cycle.
baddie-box.launch-velocity: Object velocity when launched out of the Baddie Box.
baddie-box.random-velocity: Optional randomized velocity to add on top of the base velocity (use negative numbers to subtract).
baddie-box.appearances: Baddie Box|Large Baddie Box|Goodie Box|Large Goodie Box

invis-spawner.spawn-delay-info: Time in seconds between each spawn cycle.
invis-spawner.start-delay-info: When the player gets in range, wait this time in seconds before releasing the first object.
invis-spawner.sprite-cap-info:
Maximum amount of objects from the spawner that can be alive at a time. If enemies spawned by this specific spawner are defeated, it will spawn more.
[sub]Enter 0 to have no sprite cap.[/sub]
invis-spawner.tagging-info: One or more tags (separated by spaces) to reference this spawner during gameplay.
invis-spawner.spawn-conditions: When loaded in|When on-screen|When player is in custom range
invis-spawner.spawn-conditions-info: The condition required for the spawner to create new sprites. P-Tiles will also work on option 1.

goal-and-checkpoints.flagpole-hard-block: Whether or not to have the flagpole create an automatic hard block.
goal-and-checkpoints.flagpole-skip-notice: Automatically attempt to prevent the player from jumping over the flagpole by creating an invisible barrier at the top (15 blocks tall).
goal-and-checkpoints.rightwards-pole-layering:
The layering of the pole on the right, typically layered above the player and other sprites.
[sub]You can adjust the layer to account for scenery.[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.extend-hitbox-upwards-info:
When the player jumps (up to 15 tiles) above the Goal Tape, the goal will also be activated.
[sub]Tiles above the Goal Tape can prevent this from happening.[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.player-respawn-points-info:
You can either use the checkpoint's own draggable target as respawn point, but you can also use a destination as respawn point.
[sub]The latter case is useful for long distances, or for making the player respawn in another map[/sub]
goal-and-checkpoints.respawning-map: The map the player will respawn on after a death.
goal-and-checkpoints.respawning-destination: The destination in the selected map.
goal-and-checkpoints.player-respawn-points: Use own respawn point|Use destination as respawn point

bill-blasters.sniper-notice: Sniper cannons will always aim and shoot towards the player.
bill-blasters.fire-rate-notice: How fast the Bill Blaster will shoot its Bullet Bills!
bill-blasters.types-info:
The type of Bullet Bills that this Blaster will shoot.
[sub]Missile Bills will try to home in on the player.[/sub]

cannon.base-info: Optional base sprite that becomes part of the cannon. It's purely visual and does not affect the cannon behavior.
cannon.ammo-info: The ammo that will be fired by the cannon. Cannonballs move in a straight line, Bob-ombs explode shortly after being shot out.
cannon.cannonballs-per-shot-info:
The amount of cannonballs dispensed before moving on to the next rotation.
[sub]Does not apply to Bob-ombs.[/sub]
cannon.delay: The delay between each firing & rotation. Firings happens in the middle between 2 rotations.
cannon.mode-info: The movement of the cannon. The bottom 2 options are not applicable to the stationary setting.
cannon.rotation-count-1: The amount of rotations (getting into the next position) it will do, before reversing and going into the opposite direction.
cannon.rotation-count-2:
The amount of times it can rotate to the left OR right, from its starting position.
[sub]E.g. if set to 2, the cannon can only move to the left twice, and becomes unable to track the player unless it moves back to the right.[/sub]
cannon.degrees-travel-rotation: Degrees to travel on a rotation.

advanced-platform.platform-width-info: The width of the platform, in tiles.
advanced-platform.linear-movement-info: Linear movement is moving at a straight line. Use the buttons on the left to quickly set an angle, or use the angle textfield for a precise angle.
advanced-platform.angle-of-movement-info: You can set the angle using the buttons to the left, or enter a more precise angle here for the platform's linear movement, from 0 to 359.
advanced-platform.platform-speed-info:
The speed of the platform's linear movement, in pixels / sec.
[sub]Each tile is 16 pixels, so for example, entering 48 will make the platform move 3 tiles per second.[/sub]
advanced-platform.player-activation-info: When a player steps on a platform, it is possible to activate it and/or perform an action. Check the list of actions below!
advanced-platform.tagging-info:
One or more tags (separated by spaces) to reference this platform during gameplay.
[sub]Using tags, you can enable or disable this platform with e.g. ON/OFF Tag Blocks.[/sub]
advanced-platform.optional-movement-notice: The movement settings below are optional.
advanced-platform.acceleration-info:
Optional time (in seconds) it takes for the platform to reach maximum speed.
[sub]Leave 0 for instant acceleration.[/sub]
advanced-platform.deceleration-info:
Optional time (in seconds) it takes for the platform to come to a full stop.
[sub]Leave 0 for instant deceleration.[/sub]
advanced-platform.angle-change-info:
Change the angle of movement by this value, per second.
[sub]Negative values work too.[/sub]

npc.speech-bubble-info: Short bit of text, that will be shown in a speech bubble when nearby the NPC.
npc.second-pop-up-msg: Speech bubble text after the player interacted with the NPC.
npc.pop-up-update-info: Remove, keep or replace the existing pop-up message when the player interacts with the NPC.
npc.item-stock-info: Either give an item just once, or give the NPC infinite stock to respawn an item when it gets used up or destroyed.
npc.item-options: Just once|When item is used or destroyed
npc.behavior-info:
The NPC's behavior, in movement and/or animation.
[sub]Each NPC can have different behavioral options, but some can just stay idle only.[/sub]
npc.dialogue-placeholder: What's your NPC got to say?

labels.king-boo-blend-info: King Boo can blend in with terrain in various ways
labels.attack-frequency-info: It's possible for one attack to occur more often! Check me out:

tooltips.hp-info: HP (Health Points) are the amount of hits needed to take out {0}.
tooltips.attack-cycle-info:
If multiple attacks are enabled, {0} will go through each attack in a random order. After that, a new attack cycle begins, where the attack order is randomized again.

[sub]With the 'attack frequency' option, you can have one or more attacks play out multiple times per cycle![/sub]
tooltips.bb-attack-phase: Boom Boom can either increase his attack phase automatically as he loses HP, or he can stick to one specific phase during the fight.
tooltips.bb-attack-frequency:
More frequent attacks can add more difficulty to the fight, and the stomp opportunity is shorter on the dash attack.
[sub]Note that on the dash attack, even when set to 'Near instant', there is a 1 second opportunity for the player to stomp the boss.[/sub]
tooltips.bb-movement-speed:
Maximum movement speed, in pixels / sec.
[sub]In the final phase (Pinch mode), this is multiplied by 50%[/sub]
tooltips.bb-traction: Higher tractions makes Boom Boom able to turn faster, whilst low tractions make it harder to turn.
tooltips.bb-takeoff-strength:
Jump strength when leaping into the air.
[sub]Note: only used by winged mode.[/sub]
tooltips.bb-wings:
If given wings, Boom Boom is able to fly and dive in on the player.
[sub]When 'Switch when hit' is set, Boom Boom will switch from ground to winged mode (and vice versa) every time he loses HP.[/sub]
tooltips.bw-defeat-events: When Bowser is defeated, this (optional) event gets performed automatically.
tooltips.bw-movement-speed: Bowser's movement speed when walking inbetween attacks, in pixels / sec.
tooltips.bw-walking-mode: Bowser can either stay put or walk around. The patrol area option is useful for e.g. keeping Bowser on a bridge, whereas the final option is designed for large arenas.
tooltips.bw-minimum-jumps: The amount of attacks Bowser has to perform before he has a chance of jumping, the chance of that can be set in the option below.
tooltips.bw-jumping-chance:
Chance of jumping ranging from 0% to 100%.
[sub]0% disables jumping entirely, while 100% guarantees a jump every time.[/sub]
tooltips.bw-attack-speed: The speed of Bowser's attacks, from leisurely spewing fire to wildly swinging hammers!
tooltips.kb-invincibility-period:
Time in seconds before King Boo becomes vulnerable to attacks again, after being hit. King Boo will become transparent during this invincibility phase.
[sub]Enter 0 to skip the invincibility period.[/sub]
tooltips.kb-base-speed:
Base (minimum) movement speed, in pixels / sec.

[sub]King Boo can optionally speed up in darkness with the value defined on the right.[/sub]
tooltips.kb-darkness-boost:
Maximum extra speed that gets added to King Boo when submerged in darkness, in pixels / sec.

[sub]Note that this value is divided by the level of darkness that is covering King Boo's eyes: if the darkness level is 50%, for example, it will add 50% of this speed value on top of the base speed.[/sub]

html.bw-defeat-events: No special events|Level Clear|Walk to nearest NPC
html.bw-intro-animations: None|Jump from below|Jump out Clown Copter|Disguise as Peach

text.bw-attack-desc-flame: Spews one or more flames towards the player's direction
text.bw-attack-desc-rocking-hammers: Throws multiple hammers in rapid succession
text.bw-attack-desc-blazing-hammers: Swings blazingly-hot hammers towards the player
text.bw-attack-desc-mecha-wand: Bowser uses his wand to spawn Mechakoopas. But you can use these against him!
text.bw-attack-desc-shell-dash: Bowser hides in his shell, which will then spin around rapidly. Watch your step!
text.kb-attack-desc-flame: Spews out a ghostly flame towards the player
text.kb-attack-desc-dash: Targets and homes in on the player
text.kb-attack-desc-bottle: Releases multiple Magic Bottles. Some burst into flames, one will release a fairy when stomped to stun King Boo!
text.kb-attack-desc-pepper: Spits out pumpkins and a pepper. Throw the pepper back at the mouth to make King Boo vulnerable to pumpkins!
text.kb-attack-desc-ring: Create a ring of flames around King Boo, that protect him from projectiles
text.boss-intro-anim-info: {0} can enter in style! Pick an intro animation of your liking.
text.disguised-enemy: An enemy can disguise as Bowser! Their disguise is revealed on defeat.
text.intro-anim-unavailable: Intro animations for this boss are currently unavailable in this gamestyle.

mapsnap.default-info:
Less errors, but usually has a larger image resolution and a larger filesize. 

 Images taken of maps with a level width or level height above 510 blocks will have incomplete data.
mapsnap.fixed-info:
More errors, but usually has a smaller image resolution and a smaller filesize. 

 Images taken of maps with a level width or level height above 1020 blocks will have reduced image quality.

labels.control-config-g:
Configuratio regiminis
[scale=0.65][color=#CCCCCC]Botones tabellae ludi identifiactionem numerorum utuntur[/color][/scale]
labels.offline-notice: Inconexus es, sic adjuncta LSS uti non potes.

tooltips.frame-skip:
Neclege quada cum celeritudo ludi est segnis ut pigrescendum prohibeas.
[scale=0.75][color=#CCCCCC]Monitus es: in celeritudine segnissima, problemae collisus fire possunt. Sine neclegendo imaginum, pigrescere fier sub 60 FPS.[/color][/scale=0.75]
tooltips.reduced-particles: Terminum destrictiorem forca pro particulis ut pigrescendum reducas.

tooltips.name: Nomen quod effectus hunc identificat, in fabrica sola.
tooltips.tags: Optional tag or tags (separated by spaces) used to reference this effect. You can for example use Tag Blocks to toggle this effect.
tooltips.intensity: Intensity of the effect, usually resulting in more particles at higher settings.[/color]
tooltips.downfall-tilt: Make downfall move slightly to the left or right, to simulate affection by wind.
tooltips.upwards-tilt: Make the rising particles move slightly to the left or right, to simulate affection by wind.
tooltips.environment-collisions: Downfall will phase through the environment (tiles, blocks, water, etc.) if this checkbox is enabled.
tooltips.movement-speed:
Particle / overlay movement speed (in pixels/sec)
[scale=0.75][color=CCCCCC]Each tile is 16 pixels[/color][/scale]
tooltips.flash-type:
Background only: flash the background color layer, useful for indoor areas using backgrounds with windows.
All layers: useful for outdoor areas, flashing will be visible on all layers.
tooltips.toggle-sfx: Enable or disable the sound effect.
tooltips.opacity: Intensity of the effect, ranging from very transparent to fully opaque.
tooltips.fade-duration: The time (in seconds) it takes for the effect to fade-in/out when one of its tags are toggled.
tooltips.additive-blend: Additive blending adds the color of the overlay on top of the pixels the overlay is covering. This effect is much more noticeable with bright colors.
tooltips.color-hex:
Custom color in HEX format.

Examples:
[scale=0.75][color=#C8C8C8]C8C8C8 for light gray[/color]
[color=#F8C0F0]F8C0F0 for pastel pink[/color][scale=0.5][/scale]

It is recommended to use a color picker to find your preferred HEX values.[/scale]
tooltips.palette: Palette of the effect, which is purely cosmetic.
tooltips.two-way-movement: Allows particles to also move towards the opposite angle.
tooltips.water-check: Each effect particle will check if it is inside water. If it isn't, it may disappear or start moving elsewhere.
tooltips.wind-strength: The strength of the wind, stronger strengths will make sprites get pushed faster.
tooltips.wind-buildup: The time in seconds for the wind to build up to full speed.
tooltips.wind-duration: The duration of the wind blowing (note: this does not include buildup time).
tooltips.wind-cooldown: Time in seconds for the wind to cool down to zero.
tooltips.wind-cycle-delay: Time in seconds between a wind cycle (cooldown end - buildup start).
tooltips.wind-repeats: The amount of times the wind will repeat its cycle. The delay between cycles can be defined below.

palettes.2_embers: Default Embers|Murky Black|Venomous Purple|Void Substance|Inky Blue|Royal Gold

text.duplicate-name: This effect name is already in use. Try another name.

restore-points.header: In this menu, you can restore or download a backup of a past version of your level.
restore-points.none-found:
There are no restore points yet for this level.
When you work on your level, restore points will be automatically made over time.

startpoint-missing.message-edit:
Hold up - this level doesn't have a startpoint at the moment! This is likely due to the map containing the startpoint having been deleted.

Do you want to set a new startpoint now?
startpoint-missing.message-play: Hold up! This level has no valid startpoint - go into the editor, open the settings menu, and place one from there.

level-sync-new.enter-link: Enter the link to your level on Level Share Square that you want to synchronize the level code with.
level-sync-new.info-label-1: With this feature enabled, when you save your level in-game, it will also be updated on the Level Share Square website automatically.
level-sync-new.info-label-2: When opening up the editor, the game will also alert you if the level code on the site is newer, which is useful when editing on multiple devices.
level-sync-new.sync-success: Your level is synchronized with its entry on Level Share Square! Huzzah!

level-sync-edit.sync-select: Select when you want to synchronize.
level-sync-edit.sync-options: Pause synchronization|Whenever the game saves|When I exit out of the editor
level-sync-edit.cancel-notice-1: When you cancel synchronization, the game will stop communication between Level Share Square for this specific level.
level-sync-edit.cancel-notice-2: De-synchronizing does not delete your level either in-game or on Level Share Square. You can always re-enable synchronization at a later date.
level-sync-edit.sync-cancelled: This level is no longer being synchronized with Level Share Square.

level-sync-compare.new-ver-on-site: It looks like a newer version of this level is on Level Share Square. Would you like to synchronize?
level-sync-compare.restore-point-notice: A local restore point will be made in case you want to go back.
